Description.Title: DayLength
Description.Institution: Crop Science Group, University of Bonn (INRES), Katzenburgweg 5, 53115 Bonn, Germany
Description.ExtendedDescription: SIMPLACE component that computes astronomical day length (photoperiod) in minutes from latitude and day of year. It precomputes a daily array (days 1–369) using standard solar geometry: sin(δ) = −sin(23.45°) · cos(2π(d+10)/365), with latitude φ, then day length (h) = 12 · [1 + (2/π) · asin((sin φ · sin δ)/(cos φ · cos δ))], finally converted to minutes and rounded. Inputs: cLatitude (degrees, constant), iDayOfYear (1–366). Output: DayLength (minutes). Responsible developers: Gunther Krauss and Andreas Enders, Crop Science Group, University of Bonn. More information: http://www.simplace.net
Description.ShortDescription: SIMPLACE component calculating day length (minutes) from latitude and day of year.

Input.name: pDaylength
Input.description: Precomputed minutes of daylight for indices 1..369 (index 0 unused).

Output.name: DayLength
Output.description: Day length in minutes for the specified day of year.

Function.name: _round_java
Function.description: Mimics Java StrictMath.round(double): returns 0 for NaN and rounds half away from zero.
